titleStmt.title: An act for the punishment of crimes committed upon, or beyond the seas. Die Jovis, 20 Septembr. 1649. Ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament, that this Act be forthwith printed and published. Hen: Scobell, Cleric. Parliament'.
Laws, etc.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by John Field for Edward Husband, printer to the Parliament of England: and are to be sold at his shop in Fleetstreet, at the sign of the Golden-Dragon, near the Inner-Temple,

notesStmt.note: Signatures: 5B⁴. Also issued as part of a through-paged set with a table for the entire set added.
On 5B2: last word of first line of text: "convenient"; first word of line below initial: "ed"; last word of last full line: "Ship,".
Ornament on t.p.; initial letter; text in black letter.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Fleetstreet, at the sign of the Golden-Dragon, near the Inner-Temple
